vibextractor.description: Core RPM estimation and harmonic-tuning parameters.
vibextractor.EMA_ALPHA_desc: Smoothing factor for RPM EMA (0=no smoothing, 1=heavy smoothing).
vibextractor.SNR_WEAK_desc: Below this SNR, trust previous RPM more than the new estimate.
vibextractor.SNR_STRONG_desc: Above this SNR, accept the new RPM confidently.
vibextractor.DEFAULT_SEARCH_MIN_HZ_desc: Lower bound (Hz) of RPM search band.
vibextractor.DEFAULT_SEARCH_MAX_HZ_desc: Upper bound (Hz) of RPM search band.
vibextractor.ORDER_LOCK_SPAN_HZ_desc: Span (Â± Hz) around RPM to refine order locking.
vibextractor.ORDER_LOCK_MAX_HARM_desc: Max harmonic considered in order-lock refinement.

forecast.DEFAULT_HORIZON_DAYS_desc: Number of days ahead for RMS forecasts when horizon is not specified.

thresholds.description: UI-level display thresholds for RMS gauges.

vel_rms_mm_s.ok_desc: Velocity RMS (mm/s) at or below this is considered OK.
vel_rms_mm_s.warning_desc: Velocity RMS (mm/s) above OK but at/below this is Warning; above is Alarm.
vel_rms_mm_s.dependency_note: Actual limits are ISO groupâ€“dependent; group is inferred via RPM/Power (see vibextractor.mclass/power). Use these only as UI hints.

acc_rms_g.ok_desc: Acceleration RMS (g) at or below this is considered OK.
acc_rms_g.warning_desc: Acceleration RMS (g) above OK but at/below this is Warning; above is Alarm.
acc_rms_g.dependency_note: Bearing warning thresholds also use RPM-dependent beta curve (see bearing_fault_rms.json).

paths.description: Local data files used for metadata and bearing thresholds.
paths.equipment_metadata_desc: Primary equipment metadata source (names, types, etc.).
paths.bearing_thresholds_desc: Bearing RMS threshold curve (velocity vs beta).
paths.bearing_info_desc: Bearing geometry / defect frequency reference data.

threshold_matrix.description: Matrix using existing in-code bands. Velocity follows ISO 10816/20816 groups; acceleration follows RPM-dependent beta curve (bearing_fault_rms.json).

acc_rms_g.note: Acc thresholds derive from RPM-dependent beta curve. Use ok = 0.5*beta(rpm), warning = 1.0*beta(rpm), alarm = >beta(rpm). See bearing_fault_rms.json.
